title: An Effective Guide to Process Improvement
headline: This free online course teaches how to carry out successful process improvement projects within your organisation.
description: Do you want to make a process more efficient while saving time and organisational resources? We will introduce you to the basics of process improvement in an organisation, its importance and its types. Explore various process mapping tools to help you understand an operation and develop appropriate improvement strategies. Discover the proper practices to save time, reduce waste and make a plan more straightforward to run.
courseDescription:
Process improvement is about removing waste and making processes and people who work within them more efficient and productive. This course shows you its importance and why organisations adopt process improvement strategies. A process map aids in illustrating the flow of work visually. You'll explore the role of process mapping in a project and how it helps locate areas of concern for troubleshooting and fixing problems. You'll also learn about the types of processes concerning the current, desired and future state of a procedure. The term 'bottleneck' refers to some form of constraint hindering a project's performance. You will study different terminology related to its analysis to understand and indicate the flow of a process at various stages in your workplace.

There are several steps associated with delivering process improvement. We demonstrate every step in a process improvement project, such as process identification, mapping and so on. We will teach you how to use different mapping tools, the purpose of using the tools and the desired outcomes you can obtain with the help of the process mapping tools. A case study provides a detailed analysis of a scenario in a real-world context. The instructor, Robert Chapman, presents a case study from his work experience and reveals how you can reduce cycle time, waste and the number of departments in an organisation that may not be necessary to carry out a process. Next, you'll explore how to improve the customer experience of the product/service alongside saving organisational resources.

We designed this course for people that want to make a process more efficient and effective in an organisation. It is helpful for process improvement managers who aim to assess different operations of their businesses and lay out courses of action for necessary process improvements. In a professional work environment, saving time is given the utmost priority. By following the simple methodologies outlined in this course, you will not only be able to save your precious time but also reduce costs associated with a process. Plain language and visual aids demonstrate essential procedures to make the course content more understandable and memorable. Join this course to save your organisational resources with process improvement and learn for free.
